author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Sunday extended financial aid to two budding shooting and fencing champions.

Congratulating R. Rithik, who won the gold medal in the 10-metre open site air rifle shooting under-17 event at the national-level games organised by the School Games Federation of India at Indore in Madhya Pradesh, she announced a Rs. 4 lakh incentive to him.

Rithik is a resident of Mogappair in Chennai.

The Chief Minister wished that he scaled greater heights and won more national and international accolades.

Meanwhile, in another statement, the Chief Minister said that fencing champion C.A. Bhavani Devi, a resident of Old Washermenpet in Chennai, had been included in the Special Scholarship for Elite Sports Persons scheme.

Aid for 5 years

Under this scheme, she would get financial assistance of up to Rs. 25 lakh every year for five years.

Ms. Jayalalithaa had in October provided financial assistance of Rs. 3 lakh to Ms. Devi, who had to travel to Venezuela and France to participate in fencing events following a petition from the youngster.
title: CM grants incentive to fencing champ, shooter
